comments.content:
True, do note that Block Volume can only be accessed within Oracle and not even on prem.

File Storage can be accessed within Oracle only(supports VCN peering).
For on prem access, FastConnect or VPN setup is needed.

And in addition to above statement regarding accessing object storage from anywhere(over HTTPS), Storge GW can be used to access Object storage from on prem(works over HTTPS Internet or VPN or FastConnect).

discussion.content:
Direct from OCI Guide.
OBJECT STORAGE
Object Storage is a storage architecture that allows you to store and manage data as
objects. Data files can be of any type and up to 50 GB in size. Once you upload data to
Object Storage can be accessed from anywhere. Use Object Storage when you want to
store a very large amount of data that does not change very frequently. Some typical use
cases for Object Storage include data backup, file sharing, and storing unstructured data
like logs and sensor-generated data.

Selected Answer: E
E. OCI Object Storage
IT should be Object Storage as you can create objects like files, backups. You can create buckets under Stoarge and share the URL on the internet.

comments.content:
https://www.oracle.com/in/cloud/storage/file-storage-faq.html
As per Oracle's FAQ on File Storage, it can be accessed from anywhere only after required network setup, unlike object storage which is always available on internet.
File Storage is physically located in every Oracle Cloud Infrastructure availability domainâ€”you can access it from anywhere! To access it within a region, you need only to ensure that your security rules are correctly configured to allow NFS traffic. For more information. For on-premises connection to your file system, you also need FastConnect or a virtual private network (VPN).

Because File Storage can be access only using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure FastConnect OR Internet Protocol security (IPSec) virtual private network (VPN).

ie FastConnect or VPN.
just because file storage is more private

discussion.content: Is it true file storage is a shared file system across multiple compute instances?

questions.question_text:
You are required to host several files in a location that can be publicly accessible from anywhere in the world.
Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) service should you use?
Which two security capabilities are offered by Oracle Cloud Infrastructure? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Answer is A,E.
In same material provided, security capabilities for Data Encryption are Default Encryption for Storage, Key Management, DB Encryption.

comments.content: I think the word Always is the key for encryption. Like you stated NVMe is the only storage within OCI that does not support encryption

discussion.content:
A. "Always on data encryption for data-at-rest "-> this is NOT correct. In NVMe there is NOT data encryption for data-at-reset. 

Should be B and E. It was a tricky one.

Local NVMe doesnot provide encryption data-at-rest. 
The answer shall be BE since CAPTCHA provided as part of WAF

Local NVMe does NOT provide encryption for data-at-rest. The word 'always' is tricky here.
It should be B & E
A and E. Encryption and key mgt

A and E must be the right answer
Data Security
In Oracle Database Classic Cloud Service databases, data security is provided for data in transit and data at rest. Security of data in transit is achieved through network encryption. Security of data at rest is achieved through encryption of data stored in database data files and backups.

Data in Oracle Database files, including backups, is secured by the use of encryption implemented through a key management framework. Security of data across the network is provided by native Oracle Net Services encryption and integrity capabilities.

BE might be right..
"New and existing accounts can both enable Encryption at Rest. Existing accounts must first be migrated to an Oracle TDE database before this feature can be enabled, this migration requires downtime of approximately 24 hours. New accounts are provisioned on an Oracle TDE database."
and
CAPTCHA is offered
A,E IS RIGHT AS THE LINK PROVIDING THE SAME PLEASE UPDATE IT.
A E are the correct answers

choices.D: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Exadata DB Systems
